intro: Phyllanthodendron poilanei, commonly known as the Madagascar star leaf, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces a unique, fleshy fruit that contains a single seed. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
